seo.metaTitle: Same-Day Private GP London | Illness Appointments | Dr. SNA Clinic
seo.metaDescription: Book urgent private GP appointments in Marylebone for infections, flare-ups, and prescriptions with concierge follow-up.
seo.h1: Private GP for Illness & Acute Concerns

schema.howPerformed: Your same-day or urgent GP appointment begins with a detailed consultation where Dr. Abbas listens carefully to your symptoms, takes a comprehensive medical history, and performs a thorough physical examination relevant to your concerns. We don't rush—appointments are 30-45 minutes. If diagnostic tests are needed (throat swab, urine dip, rapid COVID/flu, blood tests), these are arranged immediately either on-site or with priority laboratory booking. You receive a clear diagnosis and treatment plan which may include private prescriptions issued on the spot, injectable therapies, sick notes for work, advice for home care, or referrals to trusted specialists if escalation is needed. All findings are documented in your secure medical record. You'll receive a follow-up call or message within 48 hours to check progress
schema.preparation: Bring a list of current medications, supplements, and any allergies. If you have recent test results or medical letters, bring these. Write down your symptoms with timeline and triggers. For suspected infections, note when symptoms started and any self-medication tried. Come ready to discuss your full medical history. If booking a home visit, ensure someone is present to let the doctor in. For video consultations, test your camera and microphone beforehand
schema.followup: Follow all treatment advice and medication instructions carefully. Complete any prescribed antibiotic courses fully. If symptoms worsen or new symptoms develop, contact the clinic immediately—we prioritize existing patients. Attend any arranged follow-up appointments or tests. Expect a wellness check call within 48 hours. We can liaise with your NHS GP to ensure continuity of care if you request. Fit-to-return-to-work certificates issued as needed. For chronic conditions, we can arrange ongoing private GP care or coordinate specialist referrals
schema.outcome: Most acute illnesses resolve within days to weeks with appropriate treatment. You leave with a clear diagnosis, evidence-based treatment plan, and the reassurance of having been thoroughly examined. Private prescriptions mean you can start treatment immediately without NHS wait times. Rapid access to tests and specialists prevents complications. You have direct access to your GP via phone or secure messaging if concerns arise. Peace of mind from knowing a senior doctor has assessed you properly. For chronic conditions, we provide ongoing management and coordination with specialists
schema.medicationRequired: Varies by condition—may include antibiotics, antivirals, pain relief, inhalers, antihistamines, or other prescription medications as clinically appropriate
schema.treatmentFrequency: As needed for acute illness episodes. Some patients book regular check-ins for chronic condition management (monthly or quarterly)
schema.adverseOutcome: Minimal—consultations are diagnostic and advisory. Medications prescribed may have side effects (discussed during consultation). Very rarely, misdiagnosis (we arrange prompt specialist referral if diagnosis is uncertain)
contraindication: Life-threatening emergencies requiring 999 (severe chest pain, stroke symptoms, major trauma—we will call ambulance for you)
Conditions requiring immediate hospital admission (we can arrange private ambulance transfer)
typicalTest: Comprehensive medical history and symptom timeline
Physical examination (cardiovascular, respiratory, abdominal, ENT, dermatological as relevant)
Vital signs (blood pressure, heart rate, temperature, oxygen saturation)
Point-of-care tests (throat swab, urine dipstick, rapid flu/COVID, blood glucose)
Blood tests if indicated (sent to partner laboratory with results in 24-48 hours)
Imaging referrals if needed (X-ray, ultrasound, CT arranged urgently)
clinicalFindings: Acute infections (chest infection, UTI, tonsillitis, sinusitis, gastroenteritis)
Chronic disease flare-ups (asthma, COPD, diabetes complications, autoimmune conditions)
Mental health concerns (anxiety, depression, insomnia, stress management)
Travel health preparation or post-travel illness
Second opinions on diagnoses or treatment plans
Need for rapid specialist referral or emergency planning
